author: Ailbhe Rea
description: Mayor of London Sadiq Khan will “actively explore” building on the city’s green belt in what would amount to the biggest change to housing policy in the UK capital since the 1960s.
title: Khan Plans to Build on Green Belt to End London Housing Crisis

author: Alex Longley, Julian Lee
description: The UK will sanction as many as 100 oil tankers that it says are part of a shadow fleet of vessels helping Russia to move its oil.
title: UK to Sanction Up to 100 Oil Tankers in Russia’s Shadow Fleet

author: Chanyaporn Chanjaroen, Diana Li
description: Some of Asia’s richest families are cutting exposure to US assets, saying President Donald Trump’s tariffs have made the world’s largest economy much less predictable.
title: Asia’s Super-Rich Rapidly Scale Back US Exposure on Trade War

author: Justin Sink
description: President Donald Trump announced he was appointing Fox News host Jeanine Pirro as the interim US Attorney for the District of Columbia, after pulling the nominating of Ed Martin amid congressional opposition.
title: Trump Picks Fox News Host Pirro as Interim US Attorney for DC

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte won’t be on the ballot in Monday’s midterm elections, but the outcome could determine whether she keeps her job in a high-stakes contest centered around a feud between the country’s two most powerful families.
title: Marcos-Duterte Feud at Center of Philippine Midterm Elections

author: Lizette Chapman, Julia Janicki, Tom Fevrier, Allyson Versprille
description: The Trump administration wants startups to remake the US military, setting the stage for a battle over the world’s biggest defense budget.
title: Silicon Valley Is Coming for the Pentagon’s $1 Trillion Budget

author: Nick Wadhams
description: President Donald Trump called for a 30-day ceasefire between Russia and Ukraine to pave the way for talks on a lasting peace agreement, and threatened to impose further sanctions if a truce is violated.
title: Trump Calls for 30 Day Ceasefire Between Ukraine and Russia

author: Joe Sobczyk
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the president’s announcement of an agreement on trade with the UK. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s UK Trade Framework Leaves Many Key Details for Later

author: Alex Wickham, Lucy White
description: The UK’s achievement in becoming the first country to strike a trade deal with Donald Trump in the wake of his tariff onslaught marked a political win for Prime Minister Keir Starmer vindicating his “softly, softly” approach to the US president. But the economic benefits for Britain may be more limited — and the agreement offers a sign of things to come for other nations trying to avoid a global trade war.
title: Starmer Gets Diplomatic Win He Needs, If Not the Economic Boost

author: Jim Wyss
description: An immigration raid on a luxury Puerto Rico hotel partially owned by billionaire investor John Paulson led the US Department of Homeland Security to arrest dozens of construction workers from the Dominican Republic.
title: Immigration Raid on Paulson Puerto Rico Hotel Ensnares 53 People

author: Erik Wasson
description: President Donald Trump is pushing lawmakers to increase tax rates on some of the wealthiest Americans as a way to offset other cuts in his signature economic package.
title: Trump Seeks Tax Hike on Wealthy Who Earn $2.5 Million or More

author: Erik Hertzberg
description: Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem offered support to Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell from US President Donald Trump’s attacks, as the Canadian policymaker called the independence of central banks “sacrosanct.”
title: Powell Gets Support From Bank of Canada’s Macklem Amid Trump Attacks

author: Curtis Heinzl
description: Canadian auto parts maker Linamar Corp., once thought to be a casualty of President Donald Trump’s tariffs on cars and metals, says it’s now a possible beneficiary of the trade war.
title: Auto Parts Maker Linamar Emerges as Surprise Winner From Trump’s Tariffs

author: Andrea Jaramillo
description: The cash crunch in Colombia’s health system is forcing hospitals in the nation’s capital to close down units in order to focus efforts on other services.
title: Health Crisis Deepens in Colombia as Hospitals Shut Down Units

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Kamran Haider
description: India said it “neutralized” Pakistani drone and missile attacks targeting several military sites on Thursday night, marking an escalation in hostilities between the two nuclear-armed neighbors.
title: India Says It Thwarts Pakistan Drones, Missiles as Tensions Soar

author: John Gittelsohn
description: Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass is navigating one of her city’s most challenging periods in decades. She’s facing a nearly $1 billion budget shortfall, the long recovery from January’s wildfires, and preparations for two of the world’s largest sporting events — the 2026 World Cup and 2028 Olympic Games.
title: LA Mayor Credits Trump on Fire Aid, Stays Wary on Immigration

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: Senate Democrats blocked stablecoin legislation backed by the digital assets industry amid a furor over President Donald Trump’s extensive and growing portfolio of crypto ventures.
title: Crypto-Backed Stablecoin Bill Blocked Amid Furor Over Trump Memecoin

author: Nacha Cattan
description: The crackdown was swift and the message was unequivocal: Columbia University has little tolerance for protesters who spark chaos on campus.
title: ‘Incensed’ Columbia President Blasts Protesters After 80 Arrests

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump hailed the election of Cardinal Robert Francis Prevost as the pope, the first US national ever to be head of the Catholic Church, and said he looked forward to meeting him.
title: Trump Hails the Election of First US Pope as a ‘Great Honor’

author: Allyson Versprille, Siddharth Vikram Philip
description: US Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy called for the construction of six new air traffic control centers and the replacement of more than 600 radars in a broad proposal to overhaul the country’s aging system that manages some 45,000 flights each day.
title: Air Traffic Control Overhaul Calls for Upgraded Towers, Radar

author: Flavia Rotondi, Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Cardinal Robert Francis Prevost was elected as Roman Catholic pontiff, the first ever pope from the US and a possible bridge between the moderate and hardline sides of the Church.
title: Cardinal Prevost Becomes First American Pope; Takes Leo XIV

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: House Republicans are considering nixing a Medicaid drug pricing plan floated by President Donald Trump and fiercely opposed by the pharmaceutical industry as the party pushes to strike a massive tax and spending deal in the coming days.
title: GOP Eyes Pharma Tax Hike, Nixing Drug Price Deal for Trump Bill

author: Henry Meyer
description: A meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and his US counterpart, Donald Trump, is getting closer, according to the Kremlin’s top foreign policy aide.
title: Putin-Trump Meeting Is Getting Closer, Kremlin Aide Says

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said he is planning to abandon Ed Martin’s nomination to serve as the top federal prosecutor in the District of Columbia after he failed to secure enough support from senators.
title: Trump Plans New Pick for Top DC Prosecutor, Abandoning Ed Martin

author: Annmarie Hordern
description: US President Donald Trump said he believed trade negotiations launching this weekend with China would result in tangible progress, predicting Beijing would be willing to make concessions and saying he could consider cutting punishing tariffs against the country if there was significant momentum.
title: Trump Says ‘Substantive’ China Talks Could Yield Tariff Cut

author: Andrea Palasciano, Milda Seputyte
description: Finland has put forward a proposal to impose tariffs on all imports from Russia to the European Union that will work in parallel to existing sanctions in the latest attempt to pile pressure on Moscow over the war in Ukraine.
title: Finland Floats Proposal to Impose Tariffs on All Russian Imports

author: Billy House, Emily Birnbaum, Erik Wasson
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson said Republicans are discussing raising the state and local tax deduction cap to $30,000 — among other options — as the party seeks to resolve disagreements on the details of President Donald Trump’s tax package.
title: Republicans Discussing Raising SALT Cap to $30,000, Johnson Says

author: Olesia Safronova, Andrea Palasciano, Samuel Stolton
description: Ukraine and the European Union are poised to announce a special court aimed at prosecuting Russian President Vladimir Putin and other leading Kremlin officials for orchestrating the invasion of their neighbor, according to the EU’s top diplomat.
title: EU Poised to Set Up Court to Prosecute Putin, Kremlin Officials

author: Josh Wingrove, Hadriana Lowenkron, Alex Morales, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: US President Donald Trump announced a trade framework with the UK, hailing it as a “breakthrough” that will bring down barriers and expand market access for American imports.
title: Trump Announces Framework With UK, Lowering Trade Barriers

author: Daniel Flatley
description: The US Treasury Department sanctioned an oil refinery in China — along with port terminal operators, vessels, companies and individuals — it accuses of facilitating the Iranian crude trade, which it said funds Tehran’s military and violates existing US sanctions.
title: US Sanctions Third ‘Teapot’ Refinery in China Over Iranian Oil

author: Ben Bartenstein, Kate Sullivan
description: Trump officials have internally discussed potentially granting the United Arab Emirates, Saudi Arabia and Qatar a special fast-track status for deals, a move that could smooth the way for billions in investments, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Officials Weigh Fast-Tracking Deals With Gulf Wealth Funds

author: Alexander Weber, Jana Randow, Mark Schroers, Alessandra Migliaccio
description: The European Central Bank Governing Council was given an in-depth analysis of the risks posed by potential Russian military aggression in eastern Europe at the start of its last rate-setting meeting, according to people familiar with the discussion.
title: ECB Officials Briefed on Military Threat Posed by Putin’s Russia

author: Erik Wasson, Billy House
description: The legislative push for President Donald Trump’s massive tax package will begin in earnest next week as key House committees consider the legislation despite lingering divisions among Republicans.
title: US House Committees to Begin Debate on Trump Tax Cuts on Tuesday

description: Container ships at the Port of Felixstowe in Felixstowe, UK. Photographer: Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg
title: All Eyes on US-UK Trade Briefings as Trump Teases Deal

author: Kamailoudini Tagba
description: An Ivory Coast court postponed a decision on whether former Credit Suisse Chief Executive Officer Tidjane Thiam is eligible to lead the country’s biggest opposition party, after his defense team submitted new evidence in the case.
title: Ivory Coast Court Postpones Ruling on Thiam’s Party Leadership

author: Jorge Valero, Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union is planning to hit €95 billion ($108 billion) of US exports with additional tariffs if ongoing trade talks with President Donald Trump’s team fail to yield a satisfactory result.
title: EU to Target US Cars, Planes, Bourbon If Trump Won’t Do a Deal

author: Dan Williams, Ethan Bronner
description: Israel plans to set up distribution centers in southern Gaza and move a large number of Palestinians there, as it tries to balance international outrage over a blockade of aid to the enclave with continued pressure on Hamas.
title: Israel Plans to Control Gaza Aid as International Pressure Grows

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski, Kateryna Chursina
description: Ukraine’s parliament ratified a deal with the US over access to the country’s natural resources, lending its full support to attempts by President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to improve ties with Donald Trump.
title: Ukrainian Parliament Ratifies Natural Resources Deal With US

author: Milda Seputyte, Piotr Skolimowski
description: Lithuania is appealing to Germany’s new chancellor, Friedrich Merz, to come on board with a proposal to seize Russia’s immobilized central bank assets as the European Union debates ways to finance support for Ukraine.
title: Lithuania Urges Germany to Back Seizure of Russian Frozen Assets

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump renewed his criticism of Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell after the board declined to cut interest rates, but stopped short of repeating his call for Powell to be ousted.
title: Trump Slams Fed Chair Powell Again for Keeping Rates Steady

author: Alex Morales
description: President Donald Trump said the US has secured what he described as a comprehensive trade agreement with the UK, the culmination of weeks of talks between the two allies and marking the first of his promised deals with countries around the world.
title: Trump Touts ‘Full’ US-UK Trade Pact in Boost for Starmer After Weeks of Talks

author: Mihir Mishra
description: India has halted civilian flights to more airports that are relatively closer to Pakistan, people familiar with the matter said, signaling escalating tensions after New Delhi carried out military strikes in its neighbor’s territory.
title: India Shuts Over 25 Airports Near Pakistan as Tensions Mount

author: Alicia A. Caldwell, Augusta Saraiva
description: An influx of migrants has filled essential positions and helped keep a lid on wage pressures at a time of high US inflation.
title: What the US Would Lose If Trump Pushes Out Legal Immigrants

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Putin’s Military Parade Masks Uncertain Legacy

author: Hyonhee Shin
description: South Korea’s conservatives risk splitting their supporters in the upcoming presidential election after a second round of talks between two rival candidates ended in disagreement amid a deepening rift within the ruling party.
title: South Korea’s Conservatives Stay Split as Ruling Party Pick Digs In

author: Zoe Tillman, Christopher Cannon
description: Hundreds of court battles challenging Donald Trump's executive actions are a stress test on the balance of power at the heart of American democracy.
title: Trump Has Been Stopped By Courts More Than 200 Times

author: Greg Sullivan, Henry Meyer
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping held bilateral meetings in Moscow, emphasizing the alliance between their countries as they seek to upend the US-led world order.
title: Putin and Xi Tout Partnership Aimed at US-Led Order in Talks

author: Colum Murphy
description: Most European companies in China have so far been able to limit the direct damage from the trade war, a survey has found, though a majority conceded their business environment has grown more challenging this year.
title: European Firms in China Face Turbulence From Trump’s Tariff Push

author: Faseeh Mangi, Chiranjivi Chakraborty
description: Pakistan’s military said Thursday it shot down 12 drones from India in a sign that hostilities between the two nuclear-armed neighbors continue to escalate, prompting a plunge in stocks.
title: Pakistan Says It Shot Down 12 Indian Drones

author: Anthony Halpin
description: President Vladimir Putin is hosting Russia’s celebrations for the 80th anniversary of the defeat of Nazi Germany in World War II. The outcome of the war he started in Ukraine remains far from certain.
title: Putin Hosts Leaders to Mark 1945 Victory While His War Grinds On

author: Faseeh Mangi, Josh Xiao
description: Pakistan said Chinese fighter jets were used to respond to military strikes by India and that it has kept Beijing fully informed of its action as tensions in the disputed Kashmir region escalate.
title: Pakistan Hails Role of Chinese Jets in Repelling India Strikes

author: Patrick Sykes
description: Social media platform X blocked the account of jailed Istanbul mayor Ekrem Imamoglu, a rival to Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan whose detention sparked nationwide protests.
title: X Blocks Jailed Turkish Mayor’s Page After Opposition Protests

author: Yian Lee
description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te warned that Taiwan and Europe are under threat from new totalitarian powers in a speech aimed at underscoring Taipei’s alignment with the West amid growing threats from China.
title: Taiwan’s Lai Warns of New Totalitarian Threat in Victory in Europe Day Speech

author: Pathom Sangwongwanich
description: Thailand will seek applications to appoint a new central bank governor from next week, with the successful candidate facing the twin challenges of guarding the monetary authority’s autonomy while working with the government to minimise the impact of a global trade war.
title: Thailand Scouts for New BOT Governor as Tariff Challenges Loom

author: Akshat Rathi, David Stringer, Oscar Boyd
description: Labor Party’s climate credentials will be put to test very soon, says David Stringer, Bloomberg Green’s Asia managing editor, on this week’s episode of Zero
title: Australia’s Rebuke of Trump Is Electing a Climate-Forward Party

author: Robert Burnson
description: A group of President Donald Trump’s cabinet members who inadvertently included the editor of the Atlantic in their Signal chat about a military strike in Yemen tried to reassure a judge that they’ve done enough to preserve records of the exchange.
title: Trump’s Cabinet Defends Effort to Save Signal Chat Records

author: Carolina Millan
description: Mexican business leaders and executives lauded statements from Apollo Global Management Inc. Chief Executive Officer Marc Rowan emphasizing the need for a trade partnership between the US and Mexico, which propelled a view that a global trade war could make the US’ southern neighbor a winner amid uncertainty.
title: Mexican Leaders Cheer Apollo’s Rowan for Pushing US-Mexico Deal

author: Matthew Brockett
description: New Zealand Minister of Finance Nicola Willis asked the central bank to explain why it planned to keep interest rates at a restrictive level in the week prior to the sudden resignation of Governor Adrian Orr, documents obtained under the Official Information Act show.
title: Willis Queried RBNZ Rates, Meeting Frequency Before Orr Quit

author: Derek Wallbank
description: President Donald Trump said he plans to hold a news conference Thursday to discuss “a MAJOR TRADE DEAL WITH REPRESENTATIVES OF A BIG, AND HIGHLY RESPECTED, COUNTRY.”
title: Trump Says News Coming on ‘Major Trade Deal’ With Big Country

author: Colum Murphy
description: President Donald Trump said he will raise the case of ex-media mogul Jimmy Lai as part of trade talks with China, a move likely to antagonize Beijing just days before the two sides meet.
title: Trump Says He’ll Raise Jimmy Lai in China Trade Talks
